title: Malachi Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Malachi with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the prophet that delivered the word of the LORD to Israel in the book of Malachi?
questions.explanation: Malachi is the prophet who delivered the LORD's message to Israel.

questions.question: According to Malachi 1:2, which brother did the LORD say He loved?
questions.explanation: The LORD declared His love for Jacob over Esau.

questions.question: What did the LORD say He did to Esau in Malachi 1:3?
options: Hated him and laid his mountains waste
questions.correctAnswer: Hated him and laid his mountains waste
questions.explanation: The LORD said He hated Esau and laid waste his mountains and heritage.

questions.question: In Malachi 1:6, what question does the LORD ask the priests regarding honor?
questions.explanation: The LORD asks where His honor is if He is a father or master.

questions.question: What kind of offerings did the priests offer that the LORD condemned in Malachi 1?
questions.explanation: The priests offered imperfect animals, which the LORD rejected.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD said He will accept the offerings of the priests even if they are lame or blind.
questions.explanation: The LORD explicitly condemned offerings of blind, lame, and sick animals.

questions.question: What did the LORD say would happen from the rising of the sun to the going down of the same in Malachi 1:11?
options: His name shall be great among the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: His name shall be great among the Gentiles
questions.explanation: The LORD said His name would be great among the Gentiles with pure offerings everywhere.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A son honoureth his father, and a servant his master: if then I be a ____, where is mine honour? and if I be a master, where is my fear?'
questions.explanation: The verse questions the priests about honoring God as a father.

questions.question: What is the LORD's reaction to the priests who have profaned His name by offering polluted bread?
options: He declares the table of the LORD contemptible
questions.correctAnswer: He declares the table of the LORD contemptible
questions.explanation: The polluted bread and offerings profane the LORD's name and are contemptible.

questions.question: According to Malachi 2:2, what will the LORD do if the priests do not give glory to His name?
questions.explanation: The LORD says He will send a curse and has cursed their blessings already.

questions.question: Who is the covenant mentioned in Malachi 2:4 associated with?
questions.explanation: The LORD sent the commandment so His covenant might be with Levi.

questions.question: True or False: According to Malachi 2:6, the law of truth was in Levi's mouth and iniquity was found in his lips.
questions.explanation: Iniquity was not found in Levi's lips; he walked in peace and equity.

questions.question: What is the role of the priest according to Malachi 2:7?
options: To keep knowledge and seek the law at his mouth
questions.correctAnswer: To keep knowledge and seek the law at his mouth
questions.explanation: The priest should keep knowledge and instruct in the law as messenger of the LORD.

questions.question: What sin did Judah commit according to Malachi 2:11?
options: Marrying the daughter of a strange god
questions.correctAnswer: Marrying the daughter of a strange god
questions.explanation: Judah profaned the holiness of the LORD by marrying the daughter of a strange god.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD hates putting away (divorce), according to Malachi 2:16.
questions.explanation: The LORD declares He hates putting away and warns against dealing treacherously in marriage.

questions.question: What is the LORD's response to those who say 'Every one that doeth evil is good in the sight of the LORD'?
options: He says they have wearied Him with their words
questions.correctAnswer: He says they have wearied Him with their words
questions.explanation: The LORD says they have wearied Him by saying evil is good and He delights in them.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Behold, I will send my ____, and he shall prepare the way before me.'
questions.explanation: The LORD says He will send a messenger to prepare the way before Him.

questions.question: According to Malachi 3:2, what is the LORD likened to on the day of His coming?
options: A refiner's fire and fullers' soap
questions.correctAnswer: A refiner's fire and fullers' soap
questions.explanation: The LORD's coming is compared to a refiner's fire and fullers' soap to purify.

questions.question: What will the LORD purify according to Malachi 3:3?
questions.explanation: The LORD will purify the sons of Levi so they may offer righteous offerings.

questions.question: According to Malachi 3:5, which group is NOT specifically mentioned as being judged by the LORD?
questions.explanation: Sorcerers, adulterers, false swearers, oppressors, widows, fatherless, and strangers are mentioned, but not kings.

questions.question: What does Malachi 3:6 say about the LORD's nature?
options: He changes according to the season
questions.explanation: The LORD declares that He is unchanging, so the sons of Jacob are not consumed.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Israel were faithful to the LORD's ordinances from the days of their fathers.
questions.explanation: They had gone away from the LORD's ordinances and had not kept them.

questions.question: According to Malachi 3:8, what have the people of Israel done to God?
questions.explanation: The people have robbed God by withholding tithes and offerings.

questions.question: What will happen if the people bring all the tithes into the storehouse, according to Malachi 3:10?
options: The windows of heaven will be opened and blessings poured out
questions.correctAnswer: The windows of heaven will be opened and blessings poured out
questions.explanation: God promises to open heaven's windows and pour out blessings abundantly.

questions.question: True or False: Malachi 3:11 says that the devourer will be rebuked for the people's sake.
questions.explanation: The LORD promises to rebuke the devourer to protect the fruit of the ground.

questions.question: Who are called blessed in Malachi 3:12?
questions.explanation: All nations shall call the people blessed because they will be a delightsome land.

questions.question: What do the people say in Malachi 3:14 about serving God?
questions.explanation: They say it is vain to serve God and question the profit of keeping His ordinance.

questions.question: What is written before the LORD for those who fear Him, according to Malachi 3:16?
questions.explanation: A book of remembrance is written for those who fear the LORD and think on His name.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD says He will spare those who serve Him as a man spares his son that serveth him.
questions.explanation: The LORD promises to spare His faithful servants like a father spares his son.

questions.question: According to Malachi 3:18, what will the people be able to discern?
options: Between the righteous and the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: Between the righteous and the wicked
questions.explanation: They will discern between those that serve God and those that do not.

questions.question: What will the day that cometh burn as, according to Malachi 4:1?
questions.explanation: The day shall burn as an oven, consuming the proud and wicked as stubble.

questions.question: What will happen to the wicked on the day described in Malachi 4:3?
options: They shall be ashes under the soles of your feet
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be ashes under the soles of your feet
questions.explanation: The wicked will be reduced to ashes beneath the feet of the righteous.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But unto you that fear my name shall the ____ of righteousness arise with healing in his wings.'
questions.explanation: The Sun of righteousness shall arise with healing for those who fear God's name.

questions.question: What does the LORD command the people to remember in Malachi 4:4?
questions.explanation: They are commanded to remember the law of Moses, given at Horeb.

questions.question: Who will the LORD send before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the LORD, according to Malachi 4:5?
questions.explanation: Elijah is prophesied to come before the great and dreadful day of the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Malachi 4:6 says Elijah will turn the hearts of the children to their fathers and the hearts of the fathers to their children.
questions.explanation: Elijah will restore family relationships to prevent a curse on the earth.

questions.question: What is the consequence if Elijah does not turn the hearts as stated in Malachi 4:6?
options: The earth will be smitten with a curse
questions.correctAnswer: The earth will be smitten with a curse
questions.explanation: Failure to turn hearts will bring a curse upon the earth.

questions.question: True or False: The priests in Malachi's time were faithful and offered pure offerings to the LORD.
questions.explanation: The priests offered polluted, blind, lame, and sick animals, showing unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What does Malachi say about the priests' behavior in relation to the covenant of Levi?
options: They had no relation to Levi
questions.explanation: The priests corrupted the covenant of Levi by departing from the LORDâ€™s ways.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his ____, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?'
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the betrayal among brethren.
